meta.name: The Late Show with Stephen Colbert
meta.description: Stephen Colbert brings his signature satire and comedy to The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, the #1 show in late-night. Featuring bandleader Jon Batiste with his band Stay Human, the Emmy Award-nominated show broadcasts from the historic Ed Sullivan Theater. He talks with an eclectic mix of guests about what is new and relevant in the worlds of politics, entertainment, business, music, technology, and more. Stephen Colbert took over as host, executive producer, and writer of The Late Show on Sept. 8, 2015. Colbert is best known for his work as a television host, writer, actor, and producer, and lest known for his charity work teaching English as a second language on Tunisian date farms. Before joining the CBS family -- and being officially adopted by network president Les Moonves -- Colbert helmed The Colbert Report, which aired nearly 1,500 episodes and required Stephen to wear nearly 1,500 different neckties. The program received two Peabody Awards, two Grammy Awards, and several unwelcome shoulder massages. It won two Emmys for Outstanding Variety Series in 2013 and 2014, both of which appear to have been lost in the move. Colbert is pronounced koʊlˈbɛər, according to Wikipedia. His understudy is William Cavanaugh, who will be hosting The Late Show approximately one-third of the time. Good luck, Bill!

videos.title: Stephen Colbert's Return to New Zealand: A Magical Land Where Hugs Still Happen
videos.overview: Stephen travels to New Zealand. He introduces unseen behind-the-scenes footage of his 2019 trip to New Zealand. Viewed are his bungee jump, interview with Lord of the Rings director Peter Jackson, and learning the Māori Haka dance. New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern also appears. The segments of "Stephen Colbert: The Newest Zealander" aired in episodes on November 18-22, 2019.

videos.overview: THE LATE SHOW is going to broadcast LIVE after the primetime hearing of the Jan. 6 Committee at 11:35 PM ET on CBS and Paramount+. The episode on Thursday, July 21 will mark the 46th time since 2016 that THE LATE SHOW has broadcast LIVE, including the Emmy Award-winning election night special on Showtime. THE LATE SHOW's previous Live episode occurred on June 9, 2022, covering the primetime hearing of the Jan. 6 Committee.

videos.title: V. P. Kamala Harris
videos.overview: Vice President Kamala Harris will return to The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. This will be Harris' first late-night television interview since securing the Democratic Party's nomination for president. This appearance will mark Vice President Harris' seventh interview with Stephen Colbert on The Late Show. Her first visit to the show was on April 19, 2018, and her most recent visit to the show was March 15, 2023.
